page.title: 05The River Medway (cont.)
page.content: Looters stole goods from shops but most were arrested. By Monday morning Tonbridge was a lake with little islands. A herd of cows grazed on the Castle lawn.{Â£1,000's}of damage was caused, the Library lost{6000 books} but, miraculously, no-one died. Emergency Radio was used as telephone lines were broken. As a result of the flood the Flood Barrier was built. It was begun in l978 and finished in 1981 at a cost of Â£3.5m. It is controlled electronically from Chatham. The Barrier provides reservoir storage up-river. Many damaged buildings were removed or rebuilt. Today the Medway is used for leisure, fishing and boating. New moorings have been provided for narrow boats and lakes developed from gravel pits on either side of the town. Industry still uses the wharfs as distribution centres.
